title: System Configuration Developer
description:
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.

**Jeppesen, a subsidiary of The Boeing Company,** is one of the largest software development companies in Gothenburg. We develop and implement innovative Crew and Operations management products for the world’s leading airlines.


The Digital Solutions & Analytics implementation department is responsible for the configuration and delivery of these systems to ensure airlines all over the world can optimize their crew members’ work schedules and aircraft utilization.

 **At Jeppesen’s office in central Gothenburg** you will work in a one-of-a-kind software development organization with solutions that make a real difference to people around the world. You will work in an agile environment that fosters continuous improvement. You’ll be surrounded by a team of talented, creative, and highly motivated colleagues. You will learn and broaden your perspective by working with 400 professionals from more than 50 different nations but also be part of a global organization allowing for collaboration with customers and colleagues across the world.

**At Jeppesen work life balance is important**. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes a pension plan, health care insurance, Wellness contribution and winter break (off between 23 December and 2 January)**.**

**Jeppesen is looking for a System Configuration Developer for our Digital Solutions & Analytics implementation department based in Gothenburg, Sweden.**

**As System Configuration Developer** you will be a key member of a dynamic team of 5-10, you will actively tailor innovative solutions to meet our clients' unique crew and aircraft planning needs. You will work closely with the client to handle expectations, building long-term relations and ensure our solution brings the customer optimal value. You will collaborate with your team and other departments to solve technical challenges and programming tasks in an efficient way.

**We are looking for** solution-oriented team members with expertise in software implementation. We put great emphasis on your personal characteristics and value individuals who have an **analytical** approach to **problem solving**, **strong communication and collaboration skills** both within and outside your team, an interest in technology as well as human relations and a curiosity to learn and explore new ways of doing things. For this position it is vital that you are **passionate about** learning the **airline business** and that you see yourself as a team player ready to contribute in workshops and communicating with different stakeholders as part of the requirements gathering and implementation process.

 **Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):** **:**

* 2+ years of working experience
* Experience working with Python
* Advanced knowledge of the English language in both verbal and written communications

**Preferred Qualifications** **(Education/Experience):**

* MSc or BSc in Computer Science / Software Engineering or equivalent
* Airline and specifically Crew and / or Operations planning
* Rave knowledge
* Working with clients and their end users
* Managing a codebase using a tool such as Git and GitLab/GitHub, or equivalent
* Development and administration in Linux systems
* Software testing
* Functional Programming

**If you're ready to make a difference in the aviation industry, we encourage you to apply by sending your CV in English. We are continuously scanning CVs and would love to hear from you soon!**

 **Join us if you want to:**

* Be part of implement a new application that improves the life of thousands of airline crew members
* Have the opportunity to work with the most well-known companies in the aviation world
* Learn new things every day
* Work together with highly motivated and skilled team mates
* Work with new technologies and cloud deployments
* Have Private Medical Insurance (Skandia)
* Enjoy additional days off for Christmas break (December 24th-January 1st)
* Participate in employee recognition program (Boeing PridePoints)

  

Applications for this position will be accepted until **Jun. 15, 2025**

 **Relocation**

Relocation assistance is not a negotiable benefit for this position.

**Visa Sponsorship**

Employer willing to sponsor applicants for employment visa status.

**Shift**

Not a Shift Worker (Sweden)

 **Equal Opportunity Employer:**


We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not accept unlawful discrimination in our recruitment or employment practices on any grounds including but not limited to; race, color, ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military and veteran status, or other characteristics covered by applicable law.


We have teams in more than 65 countries, and each person plays a role in helping us become one of the world’s most innovative, diverse and inclusive companies. We are proud members of the Valuable 500 and welcome applications from candidates with disabilities. Applicants are encouraged to share with our recruitment team any accommodations required during the recruitment process. Accommodations may include but are not limited to: conducting interviews in accessible locations that accommodate mobility needs, encouraging candidates to bring and use any existing assistive technology such as screen readers and offering flexible interview formats such as virtual or phone interviews.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Development at Nolimit City (part of Evolution AB) is a challenging and exciting role where you will be part of a team dedicated to creating solutions that redefine our industry. By working in small, highly collaborative teams, you and your team will have clear ownership of one of our most important new initiatives.
   

  

 At Nolimit City, we optimize for quality, fast flows, and iterative development with short feedback loops. We have a strong focus on end-to-end ownership, continuous improvement, monitoring, and experimentation. We strive to have teams that are inclusive, helpful, and have a strong sense of ownership for what they build. Our engineers make some of the most significant decisions for the company, and we are looking for open and curious developers. As part of the Nolimit City team, you will be part of one of Sweden's fastest-growing companies and contribute to creating value for our players worldwide.
   

  

 We are expanding several of our engineering teams, including the team working on new initiatives with innovative products for our end users and work on our core products.
   

  

 Although we prefer that you're working on-site we also undertand that you have a life outside of work, meaning that working remote from time to time, leaving early, coming in late etc is not something unusual for us. A bit of a cliche; but we do in fact offer a great deal of freedom but with that comes responsibility.
   

  

 What you'll do
   

  

* Own the product from start to finish. Decide how it is best built, tested, deployed, and monitored.
* Work with large-scale, highly available, and robust modern systems.
* Be an integral part of a team and its culture and ways of working.
* Work with automated deployment enabling release multiple times a day.
* Succeed, fail, and learn together with other competent and talented people. We believe in an environment that offers growth opportunities and see education as a result of failure that brings us closer to the next breakthrough.
* Take responsibility for system design, work together with domain architects, own end-to-end problems, manage stakeholder communication, and mentor junior engineers.


 Who you are
   

  

* Tech stack should include: JavaScript/TypeScript, Node.js, React, Java.
* Experience with advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks
* Experience with APIs and product development
* A passion for writing clear and sustainable code
* Experience with agile methodologies, continuous integration, continuous delivery
* Good spoken and written English skills
* You thrive in an environment where you are responsible for your code and takes ownership of the change from editor to production system
* We understand that you might not have experience in all the areas listed above, but as long as you have the ambition and willingness to learn we would like to hear from you.


 Some of our technologies
   

  

* Javascript / TypeScript
* React / NextJS
* Redux / Redux-Toolkit Query
* Strapi (Headless CMS)
* Node.js and Express.js
* Java 17, Dropwizard
* MySQL
* PostgreSQL
* AWS, Ubuntu, Docker, GitHub Actions


 Who we are
   

  

 We are the best and fastest growing slot provider in the world with the operator and product in focus, and the mobile future on our minds. Nolimit is a team of experienced professionals from the gambling industry in Stockholm, Sweden, Malta and Gurugram, India. Our company has derived from hands on work at some of the most successful gambling software providers and operators over the last 15 years. Our mission is to offer a fast, reliable and flexible team that cooperates with the best operators in the world, taking gambling to the next level.
   

  

 We have a clean code high performance modern mini/micro service portable system platform for mobile and desktop that is 100 % under our own control. Since we have our own platform, this allows us to deliver special features and smooth, customizable marketing campaigns that are tailored to the operator's specific needs. We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games. Nolimit work with customers on a global scale and the largest gambling operators in the world have our games everywhere.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Software Engineer
description:
📍Stockholm or Gothenburg
   

  

 📆 As soon as possible
   

  

 👩🏽‍💻 Office: 3 Days a Week
   

  

 📚 Our Recruitment Process
   

  

 At Precis, we are a group of friendly experts in media buying, analytics & marketing science, creative and technology with a joint mission to help great companies thrive in the digital landscape.
   

  

 One of our most exciting products is Alvie—a cutting-edge SaaS platform for performance marketing optimization. Designed to deliver data-driven insights for e-commerce, B2C and other companies, Alvie helps businesses fine-tune marketing strategies with precision. Launched at the end of 2024, it’s already making an impact. Check it out here!
   

  

 Are you curious to learn more about us? You can meet some of our coworkers and read about our departments here. For insights into how life is at Precis and a peek at the perks of working with us, visit this page. In our Handbook, you can get a neat summary of who we are, our culture and our offices.
   

  

 We are committed to building an inclusive and fair workplace that attracts talent and advances its people, regardless of their background, experiences or perspectives. We believe that a diverse set of minds will continue to contribute to our innovative culture and our ability to reinvent ourselves constantly.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 As a Software Engineer, you will design, develop, and maintain high-quality software. You will collaborate with teams to drive project success, and continuously improve code quality and performance.
   

  

* Design, develop, test, deploy, and maintain software solutions, ensuring high standards of quality, performance, and reliability.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, as well as product managers, architects, and other stakeholders, to understand project requirements, provide technical guidance, and ensure successful project delivery.
* Participate in code reviews, knowledge-sharing sessions, and continuous improvement initiatives to enhance team productivity and technical capabilities.
* Take ownership of individual project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
* Ensure high software quality and performance by applying best practices and continuously improving solutions.


**What We Are Looking For**
* Expertise in relevant programming languages such as Python, Node.js, TypeScript, and familiarity with frameworks like ReactJS, Next.js, Flask, FastAPI, or Django.
* Experience working with NoSQL and SQL databases, with the ability to work efficiently with various data storage systems.
* Familiarity with cloud providers like GCP or AWS, as well as some experience with DevOps tools and Docker.
* Strong problem-solving skills to analyze complex technical issues and develop effective solutions, along with strategic thinking to drive innovation, improve efficiency, and ensure scalability.
* Excellent collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team and build positive relationships across different teams.
* Great interest in exploring and staying current with new technologies, with experience working on projects from ideation to production.


**Bonus Points**
* Experience with ad platforms, marketing platforms, or a strong understanding of the marketing ecosystem is an advantage.
* Experience in startup environments is also a plus!


**What We Offer**
*You can read our full offering in our* 
*handbook.*
* An intense learning environment where you will be able to grow and develop your skills and passions alongside some of the brightest minds in the industry.
* A culture that is built on collaboration, trust and innovation. We value having fun together - that’s why we also have regular afterworks, team events and a yearly festival.
* Transparent salary setting, you can find all our salary bands in our handbook. This role is a L2 or L3 (depending on the final candidate's experience) under the Software Engineer column. Check it out!
* 30 days paid leave, flexible public holidays, parental pay, a solid pension scheme and key insurance. Our different offices also offer different perks such as massage, health care contributions, free book orders, healthy snacks & great coffee, EAP programs and your choice of PC or Mac.
* A diverse environment with a high focus on inclusion and belonging. We speak over 27 native languages around Precis and our internal inclusion score is 4.3 out of 5.


**We update all candidates on their application by email. If you don't receive an email from us, please check your spam folder.**

title: C# | Senior Software Developer
description:
**Job Description**
 Are you a solution-oriented developer with a passion for writing robust, maintainable code? At Coherent in Järfälla, you'll be part of the team building software that drives state-of-the-art optoelectronic research and high-volume production.
   

  

**About Coherent**
 Coherent Corp. is a global leader in photonics and optoelectronics, operating across 73 sites in 18 countries.
   

  

 At our Järfälla facility, we design and manufacture advanced fiber-optic communication chips used in everything from short-range data centers to long-haul telecom networks. These high-performance solutions are central to cloud services, 5G expansion, and the AI ecosystem.
   

  

 With more than 330 engineers, technicians, and operators, our goal is clear: to lead through innovation and quality.
   

  

 The Role
   

  

 You Will Join a Small, Highly Skilled Team That Develops And Maintains The Software Systems Critical To Our Production Flow. Typical Work Includes
   

  

* Developing in-house applications such as our MES, chip-test infrastructure and service-maintenance tools
* Designing databases and systems, plus implementation, testing and maintenance
* Building CI/CD pipelines and driving automation across the factory
* Collaborating daily with colleagues in R&D, process engineering and operations to design new or improve existing solutions.


 Tech stack
   

  

* C#, .NET / .NET Core (primary)
* WPF and/or Blazor (highly valued)
* SQL Server (design & advanced querying)
* ORM frameworks: Entity Framework, Dapper
* RavenDB or other document databases (nice to have)
* Azure DevOps & CI/CD pipelines


 What you bring
   

  

* MSc/BSc in Computer Science, Engineering Physics or similar
* 5+ years of hands-on C# development
* Solid software-design and debugging skills
* Proficiency in English; Swedish is a plus


 Voices from the Team
   

  

*“It’s a great feeling to come into work every day and collaborate with my team of incredibly skilled, inventive, and ambitious developers. Watching the systems we build genuinely make the whole organization better is immensely rewarding.”*
 Tomas Jonsson – Manager Software Systems Engineering
   

  

*“When I started working here, one of the first feeling I got was that I found my way home. Awesome colleagues, interesting and challenging work.”*
 Mikael Gustavsson – Senior Software Developer
   

  

 Why Coherent?
   

  

 At Coherent, you’ll work at the forefront of technology in a supportive and collaborative environment. Our site in Järfälla combines global innovation with local expertise and a strong sense of community.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Cutting-edge technology and impactful work
* A diverse, international team
* Opportunities for both technical and leadership development
* A culture built on our ICARE values: Integrity, Collaboration, Accountability, Respect, and Enthusiasm


 Culture Commitment
   

  

 We work hard to ensure adherence to the company’s values (ICARE) in all aspects of your position at Coherent:
   

  

* Integrity – Create an Environment of Trust
* Collaboration – Innovate Through the Sharing of Ideas
* Accountability – Own the Process and the Outcome
* Respect – Recognize the Value in Everyone
* Enthusiasm – Find a Sense of Purpose in Work


 Practical Information
   

  

 Start: As agreed
   

  

 Location: Järfälla – On Site
   

  

 Scope: Full-time
   

  

 Ready to build the next generation of opto-electronic manufacturing tools?
   

  

 Submit your CV and a brief cover letter through our recruitment system.
   

  

 Please note that reference and background checks will be conducted as part of the process.
   

  

**About Us**
 Coherent is a global leader in lasers, engineered materials and networking components. We are a vertically integrated manufacturing company that develops innovative products for diversified applications in the industrial, optical communications, military, life sciences, semiconductor equipment, and consumer markets. Coherent provides a comprehensive career development platform within an environment that challenges employees to perform at their best, while rewarding excellence and hard-work through a competitive compensation program. It's an exciting opportunity to work for a company that offers stability, longevity and growth. Come Join Us!
   

  

**Note to recruiters and employment agencies:** 
 We will not pay for unsolicited resumes from recruiters and employment agencies unless we have a signed agreement and have required assistance, in writing, for a specific opening.
   

  

 LinkedIn

title: Software Engineer - Fleet Management
description:
10% of Europe’s CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we’re making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 You'll work in the Fleet Management workstream, empowering colleagues to provide exceptional customer support and maintenance. You will achieve this by creating systems for managing, monitoring, and troubleshooting the clean energy-tech fleet remotely. With your systems, you enable the company to address product-related issues reactively and proactively, improving quality and customer satisfaction.
   

  

 Fleet Management is a small and effective product team working towards this mission. As a team member, you will be part of figuring out how to achieve it on a product and technical level. Our current roadmap contains primarily backend work, but we see ourselves driving more frontend initiatives in the future. The role primarily focuses on backend development, though familiarity with frontend technologies is a plus.
   

  

 As a member of the Fleet Management Team, you will contribute to:
   

  

  

* Enabling deep-dive troubleshooting with visualization of real-time telemetry data
* Ensuring secure provisioning of identities in our clean energy-tech IoT fleet
* Keeping track of all devices deployed in customer installations
* Creating tools for remote distribution of firmware and software
* Surfacing problematic installations through automated alarms
* Making tools for remotely viewing and modifying device configuration
* Providing an overview of the health of our clean energy-tech fleet
* Implementing predictive maintenance.


**What You’ll Bring To The Role**
 You are comfortable with backend development and understand that there is more to information technology than if-statements and while-loops. You understand that your code operates infrastructure, and you know your way around that. You can reason in terms of how CPU, RAM, and I/O influence your systems. Most importantly, you are humble about the things you do not know, and you are open to learning.
   

  

 We think that you:
   

  

  

* Have around 5+ years of experience as a Software Engineer
* Have an analytical mindset
* Can convert an idea to clean, testable, and scalable software services
* Is comfortable co-owning mission-critical infrastructure together with your team, such as databases
* Enjoy modern agile work methodologies and collaboration
* Engage in team discussions and have a mindset to take responsibility
* Are aligned with our intention of working 4 days a week from our office
* Have experience ranging from beginner to expert in IoT and connected devices.


 Our tech stack is primarily Go, Kotlin, AWS, Terraform CDK, Kafka, Postgres, and Redis/Valkey. Our future lies in Go, so you should see yourself working with that.
   

  

 Skills and mindset go hand in hand. If you don’t meet every requirement but bring a positive and motivated attitude, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

**What is in it for you?**
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up with a supportive and inclusive culture and career advancement opportunities.
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally.
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment.
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world.
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth.
* Enjoy our brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations just a few minutes walk away.


 At Aira, we champion next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: Developer for MS D365 F&O
description:
Want continuous development and challenging work tasks?
   

  

 Want to be part of a company with a warm and friendly environment?
   

  

 If you have experience developing in Microsoft Dynamics365 Finance & Operations, this is a match made!
   

  

 As a developer on ExFlow, you will have responsibility for your tasks and the opportunity to continue developing your professional skills in a dynamic environment.
   

  

**About The Job**
 As an ExFlow Developer, you will create and maintain customer modifications and ExFlow standard features. This generally means being responsible for creating, maintaining, and improving code based on designs or instructions. As a developer at SignUp Software, you’re not restricted to just developing in X++, development can happen in the power platform, SQL, .Net Framework, or other languages as well, depending on needs and individual skills.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Create and maintain technical designs based on functional designs
* Give input on functional designs
* Develop and maintain solutions and functionality
* Participate in the “Architect board” if requested
* Perform analyses


**Required Skills**
* Experience in developing in D365 F&O (X++)
* Experience in MS Visual Studio
* Experience in MS Azure DevOps
* Five to seven years of experience in D365 F&O/AX development
* Fluent in both Swedish and English, speaking, and writing


**Other Qualifications**
* Experience in developing within AX 2012
* Experience in application MS D365 Finance/Supply Chain Management
* Experience in LCS and troubleshooting
* Experience in Power Platform
* Experience in C# or .Net Framework
* Experience in Azure
* Experience in SQL
* Experience in integrations
* Experience in working with Near/Offshore resources
* Post-secondary education in IT / Systems Science (Computer Science or equivalent)


 To thrive in this role, you have good analytical skills, love problem-solving, be a team player, and structure your tasks and priorities independently. You have an interest in helping others, like to learn new things, and to share your knowledge with others.
   

  

**What We Can Offer You**
* To be part of a successful Swedish company
* To be a part of an international and kind team always close to a laugh
* Helpful colleagues with great competence and experience
* A generous wellness contribution
* Health insurance and occupational pension
* Flexible working hours and the possibility of remote working
* Continuous competence development


**Additional Information**
* Full-time, 40 hours per week
* Start date upon agreement
* The office location is in a new, high-tech office just by Mall of Scandinavia, Solna


 Interviews take place on an ongoing basis during the process.
   

  

**About SignUp**
 SignUp Software was founded in 1999 and introduced ExFlow in 2003. Over the years, SignUp Software has earned a strong reputation in the Microsoft Dynamics community for its solutions in financial process automation. The solutions in the ExFlow product portfolio are built in Microsoft Dynamics 365 and utilize Azure Services, specifically designed for the “Office of the CFO”.
   

  

 SignUp Software currently operates from Sweden (where it is headquartered), Denmark, Netherlands, Spain, UK, USA, Canada, Singapore, and Australia, and has over 130 employees and partnerships with more than 100 resellers worldwide. Globally, over 1,500 customers rely on ExFlow to enhance their financial processes in more
   

  

 than 60 countries.
   

  

 SignUp Software was founded in 1999 and introduced ExFlow in 2003. Over the years, SignUp Software has earned a strong reputation in the Microsoft Dynamics community for its solutions in financial process automation. The solutions in the ExFlow product portfolio are built in Microsoft Dynamics 365 and utilize Azure Services, specifically designed for the “Office of the CFO”.

title: Senior ServiceNow Utvecklare
description:
Centric söker nu en Senior ServiceNow-utvecklare / Business Analyst inom SPM/APM. Vill du vara med och vidareutveckla en av de mest använda ServiceNow-plattformarna i Sverige?
 



  





 Vi söker en engagerad och lösningsorienterad person med erfarenhet av Service Portfolio Management (SPM) och Application Portfolio Management (APM) till vår kund i Stockholm. Du blir en viktig del i ett väletablerat förvaltningsteam där samarbete mellan utvecklare, analytiker, designers och serviceansvariga står i centrum. Tillsammans arbetar ni för att förbättra upplevelsen för över 20 000 användare inom organisationen.
 



  





 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att bygga vidare på sina karriär.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




 I rollen som ServiceNow utvecklare kommer du att ha både ett strategiskt och ett operativt ansvar för vidareutvecklingen av ServiceNow.
 



  





*Dina arbetsuppgifter Inkluderar:* 



* Bidra med expertis inom SPM och APM, både på konceptuell och teknisk nivå
* Utveckla och underhålla skript, integrationer och regelverk (t.ex. Business Rules, Client Scripts, Script Includes, ACL)
* Översätta affärsbehov till tekniska lösningar
* Aktivt delta i workshops och samtal med verksamheten för att förstå behov och mål
* Arbeta med olika delar av plattformen som Performance Analytics, CMDB och portföljhantering (SPM/APM)



  





**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 




  





*Krav* 



* Högskoleutbildning inom relevant område eller motsvarande yrkeserfarenhet
* Gedigen erfarenhet av utveckling i ServiceNow
* Erfarenhet av att implementera och arbeta med SPM-lösningar
* Van att kommunicera och arbeta nära verksamheten, gärna genom workshops och kravinsamling
* Tidigare arbetat med förvaltning, felsökning och incidenthantering
* Talar och skriver flytande på svenska och engelska



  





**Meriterande kunskaper** 



* On-prem eller självhostade lösningar
* Uppgraderingsprojekt i ServiceNow
* Implementering av olika moduler inom plattformen
* Certifieringar som t.ex. CSA, CAD, CIS ITSM, SPM Fundamentals eller CIS-APM



  





**Övrigt** 




*Tjänsten omfattas av säkerhetsskyddade krav och det kan därför krävas att du har specifikt medborgarskap och att du godkänns enligt gällande säkerhetsprövningar.* 




  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.
 



  





 Centric är ett IT-företag med 380 anställda och med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Salesforce System Owner
description:
**About The Role**
 Are you a Salesforce professional with a blend of administrative and development skills? Do you enjoy owning and optimizing systems end-to-end? Join Tacton as our Salesforce System Owner, where you'll play a pivotal role in scaling our Salesforce ecosystem to support our growing business operations.
   

  

 You'll be part of our Revenue Operations team, collaborating cross-functionally with a group of engaged and talented colleagues. You’ll place yourself in the shoes of internal business users, work with process flow charts to help visualize problems and proposed solutions, leverage AI to be more efficient and own/deliver the changes that need to be made – In short, you will be the Salesforce subject matter expert that has the platform expertise to drive change!
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Platform Ownership: Manage the full Salesforce platform, including user management, permissions, profiles, roles, and record types.
* Declarative Automation: Design, build, and optimize Salesforce Flows, validation rules, formula fields, and Lightning UI enhancements.
* Programmatic Development: Develop and maintain Apex classes, triggers, and test methods to support custom business logic.
* Governance & Documentation: Ensure platform governance, maintain comprehensive documentation, and uphold scalability best practices.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, and Product teams to gather requirements and implement solutions.


**What You Bring**
* Experience: Hands-on Salesforce experience in a combined Admin/Developer role.
* Technical Skills: Proficiency in Salesforce Flows, Apex development, and data management.
* Platform Knowledge: Solid understanding of the Salesforce data model, security model, and platform limits.
* Tools Familiarity: Experience with tools like Data Loader and VS Code.
* Languages: Excellent communication skills in English, both spoken and written.


**Qualifications (not a Requirement)**
* Salesforce certifications (e.g., Platform Developer I, Admin).
* Knowledge of JavaScript, Python, or other scripting languages.
* Marketing Automation (e.g., Pardot, Hubspot)
* Middleware (e.g., Mulesoft, Workato)
* CPQ (e.g., Zuora, Kugamon, Tacton)
* DocGen (e.g., Docusign)
* Revenue Intelligence (Gong, Salesloft, Outreach, ZoomInfo)


**Who You Are**
 We’re looking for someone who is eager to understand our business, who brings strong initiative and a passion for continuous improvement and development. In this role, you’ll collaborate with colleagues across all functions and roles – so being an excellent collaborator and communicator is key.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Ownership: Full ownership of a strategic, business-critical platform.
* Culture: A collaborative, open, and inclusive culture built on trust and innovation.
* Impact: The opportunity to make a tangible difference across teams.
* Benefits: 33 vacation days, private healthcare insurance, a generous wellness allowance, and more.


**About Tacton**
 Tacton is a global SaaS leader in CPQ (Configure, Price, Quote), empowering manufacturers to streamline complex sales processes and drive growth. Headquartered in Stockholm with offices in Chicago, Karlsruhe, and Warsaw, we’re a 220-person team on an exciting growth journey. Recognized by Gartner as a market leader, our technology helps global manufacturers solve real-world configuration challenges and stay competitive in a rapidly changing world. Learn more at tacton.com/about
   

  

 Tacton is a leading SaaS company within CPQ and Design Automation making sales simple for complex products.

title: Senior Power System Engineer / Kraftsystemingenjör
description:
**About Us**
 We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.
   

  

 As a trusted voice for many of the world’s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.
   

  

**About Energy Systems**
 We help customers navigate the complex transition to a decarbonized and more sustainable energy future. We do this by assuring that energy systems work safely and effectively, using solutions that are increasingly digital. We also help industries and governments to navigate the many complex, interrelated transitions taking place globally and regionally, in the energy industry.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The Power Systems Analysis Nordics Team in DNV Energy Systems is seeking a Senior Power System Engineer.
   

  

 The ideal candidate should driven by the challenges of the energy transition and the future power grid, combined with experience in delivering services in power system analysis and system studies. The focus will be on the integration of renewable generation and other power system devices such as energy storage, HVDC, and FACTS devices. Experience with grid code compliance simulations and testing, as well as protection coordination and selectivity planning, would be an advantage.
   

  

 You will be part of the
 **Power System Analysis (PSA) Nordics** 
 team of DNV Energy Systems in the Northern Europe region. The main location will be the DNV office in
 **Gothenburg, Sweden** 
 . Other possible offices include Malmö and Solna in Sweden, and Oslo in Norway.
   

  

 The PSA Nordics team is part of the Power Grid Systems and Technology Northern Europe department, consisting of around 100 highly motivated engineers and consultants who support transmission and distribution system operators, industrial clients, and renewable plant owners and developers with specialized and innovative consultancy advisory services in the area of power systems and technology.
   

  

 You will be involved in national and international projects within and beyond the borders of the Nordics and Northern Europe region. The projects are often cross-functional, where we collaborate with other specialized teams within DNV, and sometimes with external partners. As a Senior Engineer, you will often take the role of Project Manager, or work as a technical expert in projects, delivering your own technical work or coaching younger colleagues and reviewing their work. You will also interact with customers, help identify market opportunities, develop our existing services, and establish new services. Management and leadership experience is also seen as a positive.
   

  

**Your Tasks And Responsibilities**
* Perform power system studies with modeling and analysis of the behavior of power systems and electric grids.
* Perform detailed analysis and investigations related to specific topics, such as:
+ Grid code compliance
+ Fault clearance, protection, and control
+ Voltage control, frequency control, and grid stability
+ Power quality and reliability
+ Grid integration of renewables, conventional generation, storage, and power electronics (e.g., HVDC, FACTS), etc.

* Take the lead in project and proposal work, as project/bid manager or as a technical lead.
* Prepare, review, or otherwise contribute to high-quality technical reports and commercial proposals.
* Report the findings of your and your team’s work in high-quality technical reports and presentations for customers, in professional networks, and to colleagues.


***På svenska***
 Den
 **Nordiska Kraftsystemanalysgruppen** 
 inom DNV Energy Systems söker en erfaren
 **Senior Kraftsystemingenjör** 
 .
   

  

 Vi söker en kandidat som drivs av utmaningarna inom energiomställningen och framtidens elnät, med tidigare erfarenhet av kraftsystemanalys och systemstudier. Fokus ligger på anslutning av förnybar produktion och andra elkraftsystem som energilager, HVDC och FACTS-enheter. Erfarenhet av nätkoder och nätkodsefterlevnad, samt reläskyddskoordinering och selektivitetsplanering är meriterande.
   

  

 Du kommer att vara en del av
 **Kraftsystemanalys (PSA) Nordics-teamet** 
 inom DNV Energy Systems, Nordeuropa. Placeringen är på DNV:s kontor i
 **Göteborg, Sverige.** 
 Andra kontor i Malmö och Solna (Sverige) eller Oslo (Norge) är också möjliga alternativ.
   

  

 PSA Nordics-gruppen är en del av avdelningen Power Grid Systems and Technology Northern Europe, som består av cirka 100 mycket motiverade ingenjörer. Teamet hjälper transmissions- och distributionssystemoperatörer, industrikunder, samt ägare och utvecklare av förnybara anläggningar med specialiserade och innovativa konsulttjänster inom kraftsystem och teknik.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta med nationella och internationella projekt både inom Norden och utanför Norra Europa. Projekten är ofta tvärfunktionella där vi samarbetar med andra specialiserade team inom DNV och ibland med externa partners. Som senior ingenjörkommer du ofta att ta rollen som projektledare eller fungera som teknisk expert i projekt, där du utför tekniskt arbete och även coachar yngre kollegor. Du kommer också att samarbeta med kunder, identifiera marknadsmöjligheter och utveckla både befintliga och nya tjänster.
   

  

**Dina Arbetsuppgifter Och Ansvarsområden**
* Genomföra kraftsystemstudier med modellering och analys av kraftsystem och elnät.
* Genomföra detaljerade analyser och utredningar inom specifika områden, såsom:
+ Simuleringar för efterlevnad av nätkoder,
+ Skydd och kontroll,
+ Spänningsreglering, frekvensreglering och nätstabilitet,
+ Elkvalitet och tillförlitlighet,
+ Anslutning av förnybara energikällor, konventionell produktion, energilager, kraftelektronik som HVDC, FACTS, m.m.

* Leda projekt och anbudsarbete, antingen som projekt-/anbudsansvarig eller som teknisk expert.
* Förbereda, granska eller på andra sätt bidra till högkvalitativa tekniska rapporter och kommersiella offerter.
* Rapportera och presentera resultaten av ditt och ditt teams arbete i högkvalitativa rapporter och presentationer för kunder, kollegor och olika professionella nätverk.


 What we offer
   

  

 At DNV, We Provide a Supportive And Inclusive Environment That Empowers You To Thrive And Make An Impact. Here’s What You Can Look Forward To
   

  

* A challenging and varied job in a dynamic and international environment, as part of a world-leading technical advisory company with a global reach and more than 15 000 employees around the world.
* Being a central part of a professional team of committed colleagues who value teamwork and support.
* Flexible working hours and focus on work/life balance.
* Plenty of opportunities for personal growth: based on your experience, we will create a plan together with you for your personal development for the next few years. We will do this through our 70-20-10 philosophy: 70% learning on the job, 20% coaching and 10% training.
* The opportunity to make a difference by actively contributing to shaping the energy transition.


 DNV is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to gender, religion, race, national or ethnic origin, cultural background, social group, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age or political opinion. Diversity is fundamental to our culture and we invite you to be part of this inclusive and diverse workforce.
   

  

***På svenska***
 På DNV erbjuder vi en stöttande och inkluderande arbetsmiljö som ger dig möjlighet att blomstra och göra skillnad.
   

  

**Här Är Vad Du Kan Se Fram Emot**
* En utmanande och varierad tjänst i en dynamisk och internationell miljö, som en del av ett världsledande tekniskt konsultföretag med global räckvidd och mer än 15 000 anställda över hela världen.
* Att vara en central del av ett professionellt team av engagerade kollegor som värdesätter teamwork och stödjer varandra.
* Flexibla arbetstider och fokus på balans mellan arbete och privatliv.
* Många möjligheter till personlig utveckling: baserat på din erfarenhet kommer vi att skapa en plan tillsammans med dig för din personliga utveckling under de kommande åren. Vi kommer att göra detta genom vår 70-20-10 filosofi: 70% lärande på jobbet, 20% coaching och 10% utbildning.
* Möjligheten att göra skillnad genom att aktivt bidra till att forma energiomställningen.


 DNV är en arbetsgivare som erbjuder lika möjligheter och tar hänsyn till kvalificerade sökande utan hänsyn till kön, religion, ras, nationellt eller etniskt ursprung, kulturell bakgrund, social grupp, funktionshinder, sexuell läggning, könsidentitet, civilstånd, ålder eller politisk åsikt. Mångfald är grundläggande för vår kultur och vi inbjuder dig att vara en del av denna inkluderande och mångsidiga arbetsstyrka.
   

  

**About You**
 You have:
   

  

* MSc or PhD in Electrical Engineering with specialization in Power Systems.
* At least 5 or more years of relevant experience, ideally within consultancy.
* Knowledge and understanding of core technical areas: Power System Studies, Grid Integration of Generation, Grid Code Compliance, Testing & Modelling of Production Units, and/or Protection and Control.
* Experience with modeling and simulation of electrical components and networks with tools such as PowerFactory, PSS/E, PSCAD, ETAP, Neplan, or similar.
* Verbal and written communication skills in English, and ideally Swedish.
* Interest and proven ability in leading projects and interacting with customers and in professional networks.
* Ability to organize project work, support your project team to deliver, and create a good team spirit. Management and leadership experience is also seen as a positive.
* Structured way of working with high precision.
* High level of creativity, flexibility and initiative.
* Customer focus, ability to make new contacts and maintain professional relationships internally and externally.


***På svenska***
**Du Har**
* Civilingenjörsexamen (M.Sc.) eller doktorsexamen (PhD) i elektroteknik med inriktning kraftsystem.
* Minst 5 eller fler års relevant erfarenhet, helst inom konsultverksamhet.
* Kunskap och förståelse för kärntekniska områden: kraftsystemstudier, nätanslutning och integration av ny produktion, nätkodsefterlevnad, testning och modellering av produktionsenheter, och/eller skydd och kontroll.
* Erfarenhet av modellering och simulering av elektriska komponenter och nätverk med verktyg som PowerFactory, PSS/E, PSCAD, ETAP, Neplan, eller liknande.
* Muntliga och skriftliga kommunikationsfärdigheter på engelska, och helst svenska.
* Intresse och bevisad förmåga att leda projekt och interagera med kunder och i professionella nätverk.
* Förmåga att organisera projektarbete, stödja ditt projektteam att leverera och skapa en god teamanda. Erfarenhet av ledarskap ses också som positivt.
* Strukturerat arbetssätt med fokus på hög kvalité.
* Hög nivå av kreativitet, flexibilitet och initiativförmåga.
* Kundfokus, förmåga att skapa nya kontakter och upprätthålla professionella relationer internt och externt.

title: Creative Operations Manager – 45 000 kr/mån, Stockholm
description:
Är du en strukturerad, kreativ och tekniskt nyfiken person som vill ha ett varierat jobb med mycket ansvar? Vi söker en **Creative Operations Manager** – en hybridroll där du får kombinera projektledning, skapande, problemlösning och nära samarbete med VD.

**Om rollen**

Som Creative Operations Manager driver du projekt framåt, håller koll på detaljer, kommunicerar med kunder – och bidrar där du själv har mest styrka: design, webb, innehåll, admin, marknad eller struktur.

Detta är en roll med mycket frihet och stort förtroende. Du får vara med i både kreativa processer, strategiska initiativ och dagligt operativt arbete.

Du kommer jobba nära både vår VD och Executive Assistant.

**Du kommer att:**

* Planera och driva projekt – från uppstart till leverans
* Samordna team och kundkontakt
* Skapa eller kvalitetssäkra innehåll: text, bild, presentationer eller digitala leveranser
* Stötta VD i affärsutveckling, marknad, uppföljning och prioritering
* Ansvara för struktur: deadlines, mappar, dokument, flöden
* Ta egna initiativ och växa i rollen – den kan anpassas efter din kompetens

**Vi söker dig som:**

* Har ett öga för detaljer
* Är självgående, lösningsorienterad och trygg med ansvar
* Gillar struktur, men trivs också i kreativa miljöer
* Är tekniskt nyfiken och gillar att lära dig nya digitala verktyg
* Har god kommunikationsförmåga i tal och skrift (svenska och engelska krävs)

**Du måste ha mycket goda kunskaper inom något av detta (men inte alla):**

* Adobe-sviten
* Webbutveckling (WordPress, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP)
* Tillgänglighet
* UX/design
* Bokföring
* Office 365
* Projektledning, content, kampanjarbete eller marknadsföring

**Om oss**

Vi är en media- och webbyrå i Stockholm med stora kunder och snabba projekt. Hos oss jobbar du direkt med grundaren, i en personlig miljö där du får både påverka och utvecklas. Vi tror på flexibilitet, förtroende och att bra medarbetare växer med ansvar.

**Praktisk info**

* **Tjänst:** Heltid
* **Placering:** På plats i centrala Stockholm de första månaderna, sedan valfritt.
* **Start:** Enligt överenskommelse, gärna snart
* **Lönen:** För att göra det enklare för dig och oss sätter vi lönen på 45 000 kr/mån (utan tillägg) + friskvårdsbidrag.

**Så söker du tjänsten**

Gör vårt korta quiz kontakt.wcagnetworks.com/ansok-till-wcag-networks och ladda upp ditt CV. Om du har rätt svar kommer vi höra av oss inom ett par dagar. Har du inte hört från oss så har du tyvärr inte gått vidare.

Vi vet att det kan vara tidskrävande att söka jobb, därför behöver du inte skicka in en personlig ansökan till oss. Vi hör istället gärna mer om dig senare i rekryteringsprocessen.

Ha en fin dag och hoppas vi hörs igen!

Jobbtyp: Heltid

Lön: 45 000,00kr per månad

Arbetsort: På plats

title: Product-Minded Fullstack (Tech lead #2)
description:
**Company Description** 




 RealPal is an early-stage startup, working on a category-defining product in a large, slow-moving industry. Tech and product are core to what we’re building — and we’re now looking for a fullstack engineer with strong UX instincts to join early and help shape both product and tech. Equity for the right candidate.
 



  





**Role Description** 



* Tech master #2
* Work closely with the CTO to architect and build our core product
* Design and implement intuitive, user-focused features from scratch
* Develop both frontend (UX/UI-heavy) and backend components
* Jointly shape the direction of our AI-driven engine
* Help define architecture, roadmap, and engineering culture



  





**Qualifications** 



* Some years of hands-on fullstack experience – ideally shipping real products, fast
* Strong command of modern web architecture
* Able to turn Figma into real UI – polished, performant, and responsive
* Experience (or hunger) for building with AI/LLMs
* Solid backend instincts – databases, auth, API design
* Product-minded: you think in user flows, not just code
* Pragmatic, fast-moving, and unfazed by early-stage chaos



  





**Big plus if you:** 



* Have worked in startups, especially in proptech, fintech, or marketplaces
* Have experience launching user-facing SaaS or mobile tools
* Understand design systems and user behavior deeply
* Have a portfolio, GitHub, or side project you’re proud of

title: Senior Frontend Engineer - Retain
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us— and let the world feel your work.**
 We're looking for Senior Frontend Engineers!
   

  

**How You Will Make An Impact**
 Are you passionate about improving user experiences and driving engagement? Join our new
 **Retain Team** 
 , where you’ll play a critical role in optimizing the user journey—from onboarding to retention and exit processes. This position is perfect for a data-driven, curious individual who enjoys experimentation and uncovering actionable insights through statistics.
   

  

 As a team, we value open collaboration, tackling complex technical challenges together, and sharing knowledge through pair and mob programming as well as regular hack weeks. Your insights will shape and influence the team’s roadmap, so we're looking for someone who thrives in a dynamic environment and embraces uncertainty.
   

  

 Your role will include but not be limited to:
   

  

* Analyze user behavior metrics to identify opportunities for boosting engagement and retention.
* Design and test small-scale UX improvements, leveraging data to iterate and refine solutions.
* Optimize onboarding and exit processes to create smooth, impactful user journeys.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement retention strategies across the organization.
* Partner with the Acquisition Team to align strategies for public-facing pages.
* Work with the Commercial Team to deliver a cohesive and seamless user experience.


**Who You Are**
* 5+ years of extensive experience in frontend development.
* Strong expertise in TypeScript, React, and Next.js/Node.js.
* An "API-first" approach with an interest in complex architecture and integrations for scalable frontend applications.


**Nice to have:**
* Experience with subscription services, or e-commerce frontend interfaces.
* Knowledge of DevOps tools, such as Kubernetes and Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
* Familiarity with A/B testing methodologies and an experimentation mindset to refine UX through data-driven insights.


**Soft Skills**
* Adaptability: Quickly adjust to changing priorities and evolving technologies in a fast-paced scaleup environment.
* Collaboration: Strong teamwork abilities for effective cross-functional engagement and knowledge sharing.
* Problem-Solving Mindset: Proactively identify challenges and devise innovative solutions to drive progress and improve processes.


**Equal opportunity employer**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Ready to make the world
 *feel* 
 your work? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link “interested” below.
   

  

**About Epidemic Sound:**
 Epidemic Sound has transformed the soundtracking experience for global brands and professional creators, with an expansive catalog of world-class music and sound effects that's seen and heard over 2.5 billion times a day around the globe. Providing a direct license model that comes with all rights included and next-generation soundtracking tools, Epidemic Sound empowers creators to unlock more feeling in everything they create and share their stories with the world. Epidemic Sound continuously enriches its world-class catalog of music by teaming up with artists, composers, and producers to create tracks spanning all genres, while supporting them financially and creatively.
   

  

**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: AI and Cloud Technologies Trainer - Scandinavia/Nordics
description:
UpSkill Universe was founded on the principle of empowering individuals, organisations and their leadership to adapt to the ever-changing digital landscape. We develop and deliver human-centred, experiential learning programmes and events for organisations looking to empower people and stimulate economies from a grassroots level.


Using our incredible roster of talent (that’s you!), we empower teams to adapt as roles change and evolve so that businesses and individuals remain relevant and competitive in an ever-changing, digitally disrupted landscape.


What's more, we do this all virtually, using the latest technologies to ensure that our learning experiences reach the right people in the right way.


Does this all sound exciting? Great, because we need YOU to help us drive our learning programs. We are committed to working with the best training experts in the business to engage, excite and educate consumers and businesses on technology, tools and solutions that will empower all people to succeed with tech.

**Role overview**  

  

The AI and Cloud Technologies Trainer will be responsible for delivering a comprehensive training program to public sector, government officials, and policymakers. The training aims to enhance participants' understanding of and confidence in AI and Cloud technologies, focusing on their impact, opportunities, and risks.

**Main duties**

*Training Delivery:*


Deliver high-quality training sessions on AI and cloud technologies


Use the publicly available frameworks to structure training content, ensuring a comprehensive exploration of data, infrastructure, policy, and education.


Adapt training materials to different learning environments, whether in-person, remote, or hybrid sessions.

*Stakeholder Engagement:*


Engage with a variety of stakeholders to understand their specific learning needs and challenges.


Provide tailored advice and guidance to participants, helping them apply the concepts learned to their specific contexts.

*Assessment and Feedback:*


Assess the effectiveness of your training sessions through ensuring participant feedback completion (via our satisfaction surveys), assessments, and engagement metrics.


Provide constructive feedback to participants to aid their understanding and application of AI and cloud technologies.

*Continuous Improvement:*


Stay updated on the latest developments in AI, cloud technologies, and their applications for social good.


Contribute to the continuous improvement of training programs by incorporating new insights, technologies, and best practices

**Essential Qualifications and Experience**


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, International development or equivalent in a related field.


Professional certification in Google Cloud Platform (e.g., Google Cloud Certified - Professional Data Engineer, Professional Cloud Architect).


Proven experience (minimum 3 years) as an AI Trainer or similar role.


A minimum of 3 years of experience in facilitating classroom-based training sessions, specifically in technical subjects such as AI, cloud technologies, or related fields, with a proven ability to engage participants, manage group dynamics, and adapt teaching methods to different adult learning styles.


Strong knowledge of AI technologies, including machine learning, deep learning, NLP, and computer vision.


Experience with AI frameworks and tools.


Ability to travel for training sessions and conferences if required.


Advanced skills in using digital platforms and interactive tools for remote training, such as Zoom, Google Meet, and interactive whiteboard tools.

**Desired qualifications and experience**


Advanced degree (Master’s or PhD) in AI, Data Science, or a related field.


Certification or formal training in AI ethics, data privacy, or relevant policy frameworks.


Language Proficiency: Fluent in English

**Submission requirement**


To apply for the role of AI & Cloud trainer, please complete the following steps:

**1. Submit Your CV:** Include relevant professional experience, qualifications, and certifications, particularly in digital marketing and training delivery.

**2. Create and Submit a Short Video** (10 minutes total max)- include:

***Introduction:*** Provide a brief introduction of yourself, including your background, expertise, and why you are interested in this role.

***Workshop Delivery:*** Demonstrate your training style by delivering a concise lesson on a topic related to Cloud & AI. Ensure your video showcases your ability to present clearly, engage learners, and deliver actionable insights. Feel free to use a short deck for this.

**Submission Deadline:** All materials must be submitted by Monday, 16 June 2025. Selection Process: Shortlisted candidates will be invited to attend an interview during June 2025.

title: Senior Software Engineer - Stockholm
description:
Our mission is to deliver breakthrough products that enable and empower those that own and operate the supply chains of the world. Our vision and mission drive everything that we do and are at the core of our strategy. Our people sit at the centre of all of this.


WiseTech Global provides the world’s most comprehensive solution for companies operating in the increasingly complex world of logistics. It has never been a more important time for organisations to have a resilient supply chain. Our industry-leading flagship product, CargoWise, is centralising logistics operations on a single global database, delivering business continuity, scalability and security.


At the very core of this is our CargoWise Native Customs functionality. This platform accounts for over 75% of global manufactured trade flows, a number that is growing year on year. Our target is for this to get to 90%. To help facilitate this growth, we are looking for ambitious engineers, who want to solve deeply complex problems with others of a similar mindset. The work you do in this team has a genuine, meaningful real world impact.


We trust our developers to get the job done with minimal distractions and micromanagement. We empower our people to grow and develop continuously throughout their career and view everyone as potential people leaders. Problem solving skills, curiosity and passion are the key skills we look for in our Engineers, but for your own interest the technology you can expect to work on will be:


* Working across MS technologies such as C#, SQL Server and ASP.Net
* Strong approach to quality, using Test Driven Development
* Experience with CI/CD
* Understanding of design patterns on principles of design


If you have what it takes to connect the unconnected and tie together the many moving parts of the world’s supply chains - then apply. Link your GitHub or your Stack Overflow account. Stand out in your application, and we will help you stand out in your career.


#### **About WiseTech Global**


Having listed on the ASX in 2016, WiseTech Global is now an ASX 50, AU$15 billion+ company that is serious about expansion and technical innovation. Through a combination of organic growth and targeted acquisitions, our global employee head count has increased rapidly, and we’re far from slowing down.


We are known for our vibrant, dynamic workplace where personal and professional fulfilment and company success go hand in hand. Working at WiseTech provides you with the ability to work in an industry leading culture with high levels of autonomy and ownership.


#### **Before you Apply**


*From time to time, WiseTech Global may use an external service provider to assess applications on our behalf. Accordingly, by applying for this role and providing your personal information to WiseTech Global, you consent to WiseTech Global providing this information to our external service providers who are required to treat such information with strict confidentiality in line with privacy and data protection laws and regulations.*

title: Platform Engineer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------

 **About this opportunity**  

Join our dynamic team at Ericsson Fintech, where you'll help shape and operate one of the world's largest Fintech products. We're dedicated to using technology for societal good, empowering hundreds of millions daily.  

Our systems are used by hundreds of millions every day for services such as peer-to-peer transfers, payments, disbursements, loans, savings etc. The Ericsson Fintech Platform brings financial freedom and improves the lives of all those users.  

Are you our new colleague? We need more DevOps engineers who are passionate about achieving results by teamwork in our rapidly growing business!  

Visit this link for more information about Ericsson Wallet Platform https://www.ericsson.com/en/mobile-financial-services

 **What you will do**  

The profile we are looking for is a customer-minded colleague, with a strong background in solution delivery, platforms and Infrastructure development and operations. You will work in all phases of the life cycle including installation, upgrade, troubleshooting, integration and maintenance, but also be a key stakeholder for improving our product to meet all the future DevOps demands. Our ways of working are based on agile principles, and we are organized in a DevOps structure, where you will play a vital role.

 **You will bring**  

The candidate enjoys working in teams with ability to lead and work in a multinational, multi-site, and cross-functional teams set-up. Additionally, we believe the candidate has good analytical and communication skills and high skills in oral and written English.  

  

* Education: Academic degree, minimum on bachelor level, in engineering (IT, Telecom)
* Linux/Unix experience
* Understanding and experience of working with containers and Kubernetes as well as virtualization
* Broad understanding of SAN/LAN/WAN/Server technologies, preferably HPE/Broadcom/F5/EMC
* Understanding of security in a containerized and virtualized environment and experience of working with Firewalls
* Experience of end-to-end troubleshooting
* Scripting (e.g. Python)
* Team player that enjoys working in multi-culture environment
* Positive attitude with a passion to win
* Experience of driving automation to secure efficiency and ease of use is a merit
* Oracle database experience is a merit
* Terraform and Ansible infrastructure as code tools is a merit
* Technical experience and competence of running bank/financial systems is a merit
**Application**  

We look forward to your application with CV in English. We target 60% work-from-office.  

Last day to apply: 16th of June 2025  

Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond for applications sent via e-mail.


If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact Raheleh Rouhani, Sr Talent Acquisition Partner at raheleh.rouhani@ericsson.com


Location: Karlskrona, Sweden

 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Karlskrona
